comment.author: 59436858@N08
comment._content:
Pit sawing on Mulanje, still practised into the 1980's, one man below in "pit" pulls the saw down then man above pulls up and so on. A bit dusty for the man below. Planks then headloaded down the mountain, two planks per man each 12 feet x 1 foot x 2 inches.
Widdringtonia whytei timber, strong smell resist termite attack.
